alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; St. Clair; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 03 at 8:07PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...NEAR BLIZZARD CONDITIONS THIS EVENING AND A WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and near blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Locally higher totals possible toward M-59 and lower totals toward the Ohio border. Northerly wind gusts as high as 35 to 45 mph. * WHERE...St. Clair, Livingston, Oakland, Macomb, Washtenaw, Wayne, Lenawee and Monroe Counties. * WHEN... now until 4 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS... Dangerous travel conditions tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Recent reports of the rain/snow line reach as far north as the I-94 corridor this evening where heavy rain and snow pellets mixed in with heavy snow. A switch back to all snow is expected during late evening. Farther north, the evening peak of this winter storm occurs with an additional 3 to 6 inches of snow for storm totals in the 6 to 10 inch range. Local totals around a foot are possible along and north of M-59. The heavy snow combines with wind gusts near 40 mph to produce whiteout conditions at times. Power outages remain possible due to the wind and wet snow loading on power lines and tree limbs. Both snow and wind diminish after midnight with rapid improvement still expected by 4 AM tonight.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; St. Clair; Washtenaw; Wayne
